text: One night, on the banks of the Nile, a hyena encountered a crocodile. They both stopped and said hello. The hyenas said, "How are you doing today, sir?" "Very bad", replied the crocodile. Sometimes, in my pain and sadness, I cry. And then the creatures say, "They're crocodile tears". And that hurts me a lot more than I could tell. And the hyenas said, Thou speakest of thy sorrow and of thy sorrow; but think a moment of me. I look at the beauty of the world, its wonders and its miracles and, full of joy, I laugh, as laugh the days. And the forest dwellers say, "It's nothing but a hyenas laugh". FIN
title: Lágrimas y risas
author: Gibrán Jalil Gibrán
